title: Win11 taskbar does not show fox icon
content: I have a new computer with Win11. I downloaded Firefox (against all the altruistic advice of MS) and pulled its shortcut into the Win11 taskbar. The button in the taskbar is shown as a blank sheet of paper. The icon in the Firefox window tab bar looks like the front of a filing cabinet drawer. The desktop icon for Firefox is still the curled fox. Has MS edited Firefox out of its world view since Win10?
creator: cvhorie

title: Reset Firefox dark mode source code?
content: I'm not very computer savvy but I followed a website a few months ago to edit Firefox so it'd default to dark mode. I think I went in and edited source code? I can't find the instructions anymore but I'd like to revert back to the original setting. How do I do that? I tried to refresh Firefox but it's still coming back with some websites in dark mode and some not. Please advise!
creator: helenchao1314

title: ESPN on Firefox
content:
Why does Firefox cut off the bottom of the score banner on ESPN website? (See screenshot)! This question was asked 5 years ago and was never really answered correctly https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1189999 

(I tried the suggestions made there, but the issue persists), so please don't refer me to that answer.

As you can see, MS Edge has no issue with it, nor does Opera.
creator: hk2000

title: Not able to use Last Pass after Firefox version became Mozilla
content: Please enable all approved extensions when you update.
creator: MotherM

title: Why do I have duplicate Firefox Accounts? T-Bird sends links to the empty FF Acct that has no username or password.
content:
When I receive an email via Thunderbird with a link to a URL, Firefox opens an entirely new profile. The new profile has no user name or password, but it seems to have my email address. The new, empty, Firefox profile contains no bookmarks, passwords, or anything useful.

If the URL points to a website for which I have a saved password in my regular and robust Firefox profile, the website won't open in the empty shell Firefox account. The website treats me like an unknown user and asks me to create a new account. (E.g., LinkedIn, but there are others including personal emails.) I have to copy the URL from the empty Firefox account and paste it into my regular account.

I am the only user. There should only be one Firefox Profile. I am using Windows 11, upgraded from 10. I don't know which Firefox version I am using. I can't even find the duplicate profile to delete it!

This has happened once before and I don't remember how I fixed it. Is Edge messing with my computer? Many thanks for any help you can give.
creator: mshumaker

title: Trying to Run Java In Browser In Linux
content: I'm trying to run Java in the browser on Linux, but it's not working. I've gone all the way back to Ubuntu 7.10 where the default Java is included with the operating system by default, and it is NOT detected in the latest version of the web browser that it can run, which is 17.

title: Connessione interrotta: potenziale rischio per la sicurezza
content:
salve non mi funzionano molti siti web e non riesco a navigare,questo è l'errore:


Connessione interrotta: potenziale rischio per la sicurezza

Firefox ha rilevato una potenziale minaccia per la sicurezza e interrotto la connessione con www.youtube.com, in quanto è possibile collegarsi a questo sito solo in modo sicuro.

Che cosa posso fare per risolvere?

www.youtube.com utilizza un criterio di sicurezza chiamato HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). Questo significa che Firefox può connettersi solo in modo sicuro e non è possibile aggiungere un’eccezione per visitare questo sito.

L’errore è probabilmente causato dal sito web e non può essere risolto.

Se si stanno utilizzando una rete aziendale o un software antivirus, contattare i team di supporto per ottenere assistenza. È inoltre possibile segnalare il problema al gestore del sito web.

Ulteriori informazioni…

Potrebbe trattarsi di un tentativo di sostituirsi al sito originale e non si dovrebbe proseguire.

I siti web garantiscono la propria identità attraverso certificati. Firefox non considera www.youtube.com attendibile in quanto l’emittente del certificato è sconosciuto, il certificato è autofirmato oppure il server non ha inviato i certificati intermedi previsti.

Codice di errore: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER

Visualizza certificato.

ho provato a riavviare il modem adsl ma il problema persiste,grazie.
creator: riccardo.dottori37
